alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 1:38PM MST until August 17 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MST/430 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR APACHE COUNTY... At 132 PM MST /232 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rainfall about 5 to 10 miles south of Wheatfields in Apache County on the Navajo Reservation has stopped. However, between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell earlier. Due to that, flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sonsela Buttes, Wheatfields Lake, Canyon De Chelly National Monument, Spider Rock Overlook, Face Rock Overlook, Antelope House Overlook, White House Overlook, Junction Overlook, Tsegi Overlook, Canyon de Chelly N.M. and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Black Rock Canyon, Whiskey Creek, Coyote Wash, Muerto, Canyon del and Wheatfields Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
